Noninvasive markers for fibrosis, including the FIB-4 score, have not been reliable in patients with chronic HDV infection.
15 The greater degree of inflammation in HDV compared with HBV monoinfection likely alters elastography measurement. A recent study showed that vibration-controlled transient elastography may have reasonable accuracy to detect cirrhosis
16 but remains to be validated and has not yet been studied for grading lesser degrees of fibrosis. Thus, liver biopsy is typically still required for accurate grading of inflammation and staging of fibrosis.
